messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stephen Hawking's Universe
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for this info, Joyce. I m in the process of reading A Briefer History of Time by Hawking. ~Katherine
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for this info, Joyce. I"m in the process of reading A Briefer
History of Time by Hawking.

~Katherine

messages.subject: Re: Stephen Hawking's Universe
messages.msgSnippet: My 13 yo has been telling me all kinds of things lately because of this show.  He loves it too. Joanna
messages.messageBody:
My 13 yo has been telling me all kinds of things lately because of this show. He loves it too.

Joanna

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "Colin" <chiggins1066@...> wrote:
>
> My home-schooled 7 year old LOVES this show. After watching the latest episode, he went up to my wife and said:
>
> "Mommy, after the big bang, the universe expanded in less than a second! And there wasn't even any light at first."
>
> I highly recommend the show
>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Stephen Hawking's Universe
messages.msgSnippet: ... There are two similar shows on Discovery -- and it took me a bit to puzzle it out. One is How the Universe Works that had Stephen Hawking in it briefly.
messages.messageBody:
On May 4, 2010, at 7:59 PM, Colin wrote:

> I highly recommend the show

There are two similar shows on Discovery -- and it took me a bit to
puzzle it out. One is "How the Universe Works" that had Stephen
Hawking in it briefly. The first show was about the Big Bang.

The other is Stephen Hawking's "Into the Universe". It was only 3
episodes long and repeats aren't scheduled for some reason. There are
clips at Discovery:

Hawking show

which might be the whole thing in 3-4 minute segments. (They'll keep
playing with a commercial in between.)

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Stephen Hawking's Universe
messages.msgSnippet: My home-schooled 7 year old LOVES this show. After watching the latest episode, he went up to my wife and said: Mommy, after the big bang, the universe
messages.messageBody:
My home-schooled 7 year old LOVES this show. After watching the latest episode, he went up to my wife and said:

"Mommy, after the big bang, the universe expanded in less than a second! And there wasn't even any light at first."

I highly recommend the show
